meaning: good enough, although not very good
example: The party's all right, but the music's a bit boring.

meaning: very bad, of low quality, or unpleasant
example: We saw an awful film.

meaning: not interesting or exciting
example: The party's alright, but the music's a bit boring.

meaning: If food or drink is delicious, it smells or tastes extremely good
example: The pizza is delicious.

meaning: exactly right for someone or something
example: It's a perfect day for a party.

meaning: If something is strange, it is surprising because it is unusual or unexpected.
example: It's a really strange story.

meaning: completely
example: I absolutely hate rude people.

meaning: every time or all the time
example: I always have coffee with my breakfast.

meaning: more than other things or people, or much more than usual
example: I love rock music, but I especially like the Rolling Stones.

meaning: more than average, but less than very
example: I think Facebook is fairly good.

meaning: usually, or in most situations
example: I generally text my friends.

meaning: almost never
example: I hardly ever send postcards.

meaning: mostly or to a large degree
example: I mainly see my family at weekends.

meaning: not at any time or not on any occasion
example: I have never been to Australia.

meaning: usually
example: I normally enjoy horror films, but this one was awful!

meaning: many times
example: I often get lost in big cities.

meaning: especially
example: I particularly enjoy getting letters.

meaning: quite, but not extremely
example: I’m pretty sure my mum can’t use Skype.

meaning: not often
example: She rarely takes her family out for dinner - only when it's her birthday.

meaning: very or very much
example: I’m really into blogs.

meaning: on some occasions but not always or often
example: I sometimes work from home.

meaning: in the way that most often happens
example: I usually go swimming on Saturdays.

meaning: used to introduce a new subject to be considered or to give further information
example: By the way, I'm going out later.

meaning: used to talk about the present time, in comparison with the past
example: Nothing is cheap these days.

meaning: a little or a lot but not completely
example: I thought the food was quite good.

meaning: very surprising
example: The room looks amazing

meaning: very beautiful or pleasant
example: The fruit salad is gorgeous!

meaning: very unpleasant or bad
example: The weather's horrible today.

meaning: pleasant or enjoyable
example: The weather's lovely today.

meaning: behaving in a way which is not polite and upsets other people
example: It's very rude to arrive so late.

meaning: A serious problem or situation is bad and makes people worry.
example: Perhaps he has a serious problem.

meaning: stupid
example: What a silly game this is!

meaning: unpleasant to look at
example: The carpet's a bit ugly.

meaning: a rectangular case with a handle that you use for carrying clothes when you are travelling
example: We collected our suitcases from the arrivals hall.

meaning: dark glasses that you wear to protect your eyes from the sun.
example: He had short dark hair, a hat and sunglasses.

meaning: a substance that protects your skin from the sun
example: Remember to wear suntan lotion on the ship.

meaning: a large vehicle in which people are driven from one place to another
example: I took the bus to school.

meaning: a road vehicle for a small number of people
example: For long trips we go by car.

meaning: a long vehicle with comfortable seats, used to take groups of people on journeys
example: My parents have gone on a coach trip.

meaning: walking
example: I prefer to travel on foot where I can.

meaning: a vehicle designed for air travel, with wings and one or more engines
example: I will be travelling to Spain by plane.

meaning: a railway engine carrying people (in carriages) or goods (in containers)
example: My favourite way to travel is by train.

meaning: to arrange to stay in a place at some time in the future
example: We booked all of our accommodation online.

meaning: to buy presents or things you want to keep yourself from a place where you are on holiday
example: We bought souvenirs for our friends and family.

meaning: to go to the desk at the front of a hotel to say that you have arrived
example: When we arrived, we checked into our luxury hotel and unpacked our luggage.

meaning: to leave a hotel after paying your bill
example: The second week, we checked out of our hotel and stayed in a hostel.

meaning: to visit places that are interesting because they are historical, famous, etc.
example: We did some sightseeing. The castles and gardens were gorgeous!

meaning: to buy money from one country with money from another country
example: We exchanged some money at the bank.

meaning: to get an official mark in your passport that allows you to enter or leave a particular country
example: We needed to get a visa from the embassy before we travelled.

meaning: to go somewhere for a holiday
example: We went away on holiday for three weeks.

meaning: to do something exciting
example: We had a great adventure and we didn’t want to come home.

meaning: to stay in a place like a cheap hotel, often with several people in the same room
example: The second week, we checked out of our hotel and stayed in a hostel.

meaning: to stay in an area where people can stay in tents for a holiday
example: The third week we stayed on a campsite by the beach.

meaning: to take your clothes and other things out of your suitcase
example: When we arrived, we checked into our luxury hotel and unpacked our luggage.

meaning: an official mark in your passport that allows you to enter or leave a particular country
example: We needed to get a visa from the embassy before we travelled.

meaning: to get onto a train
example: We boarded a train to Paris.

meaning: If a machine or vehicle breaks down, it stops working.
example: My car broke down on the motorway.

meaning: to get off a bus, plane, etc and catch another, in order to continue a journey
example: We changed at Strasbourg.

meaning: when you have to wait longer than expected for something to happen, or the time that you have to wait
example: There was a delay at the station.

meaning: to go somewhere and then not know where you are or where you should go
example: We got lost in the city centre.

meaning: to arrive in a place
example: We got to Paris at seven thirty.

meaning: to take someone somewhere in your car
example: A kind man gave us a lift to Frankfurt.

meaning: to have an accident in which a vehicle hits something
example: I had a crash on the drive to work.

meaning: to get free rides in people's vehicles by standing next to the road and waiting for someone to pick you up
example: We hitchhiked across Germany.

meaning: If an aircraft lands, it arrives on the ground after a journey.
example: We landed on time in Berlin.

meaning: a long line of people waiting for something
example: There was a long queue at the ticket office.

meaning: to arrive too late to get on a train
example: They missed their train.

meaning: to start a journey
example: We set off in June.

meaning: a period of time when people are not working because they want more money, etc
example: There was a strike so there were no buses.

meaning: to leave the ground in an aeroplane
example: We took off late from London.

word: to be sth wrong with sth
meaning: If there is something wrong with a machine, it does not work in the way it should.
example: There was something wrong with the plane.

meaning: a line of cars, trucks, etc that are moving slowly or not moving at all
example: The traffic jam went on for miles down the road.

meaning: to move around a place in a vehicle
example: We travelled around Europe last year.

meaning: strong sudden movements in air or water
example: There was a lot of turbulence during the flight.

meaning: a bag that you carry on your back
example: I put a bottle of water in my backpack.

meaning: money from another country
example: You can get foreign currency at the bank.

meaning: a book that gives visitors information about a particular place
example: We were sitting outside a café, reading the guidebook.

meaning: a picture that shows where countries, towns, roads, rivers, etc are
example: The GPS wasn't working so we bought a map.

meaning: an official document, often a small book, that you need to enter or leave a country
example: You can get a new passport at the embassy.

meaning: an arrangement with a bank to keep your money there and take it out when you need to
example: Brian only had £400 in his bank account.

meaning: something on sale at a lower price than its true value
example: I found this dress at a bargain price.

meaning: a reduction in price
example: Brian asked the shop assistant for a discount but she said no.

meaning: to pay someone the money that you owe them
example: Carol paid back the £700 pounds.

meaning: an occasion when goods are sold at a lower price than usual
example: I bought a shirt in the sale last week.

meaning: a price that is lower than usual
example: When Brian got home he found a special offer online.

meaning: a time when shops sell goods at a lower price than usual
example: One day Carol and Fay went shopping in the sales.

meaning: to do something kind
example: That was the nicest thing a stranger has ever done for me.

meaning: to do work that you are not paid for
example: I have been to Haiti three times to do volunteer work.

meaning: to be successful
example: The boy is doing really well at school.

meaning: to put your arms around someone
example: You should give someone who looks sad a hug.

meaning: to give an extra amount of money to someone like a waiter or a taxi driver
example: I gave the waitress a big tip.

meaning: offer someone an opinion about what they should do or how they should act
example: He gave me some advice which really helped me.

meaning: to tell someone how to get to a place
example: I often give people directions.

meaning: to give something to someone without asking for any money
example: I give away my old clothes to charity.

meaning: to become friendly with someone
example: A few weeks ago, I made a new friend.

meaning: to say something that is funny
example: I try to make a joke when people are bored.

meaning: to write something down or remember it carefully
example: She made a note of what they'd agreed.

meaning: to make someone's mouth curve up because they are happy
example: I bought everyone drinks and made them smile.

meaning: a small, rectangular piece of card or plastic, used to prove your identity or make purchases
example: I'd like to pay by card, please.

meaning: a piece of paper or message proving that money, goods, or information have been received
example: Would you like your receipt?

meaning: to have enough money to buy something
example: Brian couldn’t afford the camera.

meaning: to use something that belongs to someone else and give it back later
example: Fay offered to lend Carol some money, so she borrowed £100.

meaning: money in any form
example: Carol saw some shoes she loved, but she didn’t have any cash.

meaning: If something costs a particular amount of money, you have to pay that in order to buy or do it.
example: Brian saw a great camera but it cost £499.

meaning: to borrow money from a bank
example: Carol got a loan for £1000 from the bank.

meaning: to give something to someone for a period of time, expecting that they will then give it back to you
example: Fay offered to lend Carol some money, so she borrowed £100.

meaning: to have to pay money back to someone
example: Carol owed Fay £700.

meaning: to keep money so that you can buy something with it in the future
example: Brian was saving up for a camera.

meaning: to use money to buy or pay for something
example: Carol spent a lot of money on shoes.

meaning: from a long time ago
example: Stonehenge is an ancient monument in Wiltshire in England.

meaning: very full of people
example: The palace is nice but it’s so crowded.

meaning: not containing any things or people
example: The park is empty at that time of day.

meaning: having a large distance from the bottom to the top
example: The hills in the South of England are quite high.

meaning: extremely large
example: It’s a huge park so it’s always really nice.

meaning: happening, used, or existing in a building
example: I’ve arranged to meet my friend at an indoor shopping mall in Santa Monica.

meaning: near the ground, not high
example: The hills here are quite low.

meaning: very good or very beautiful
example: The city has some magnificent buildings.

meaning: using the newest ideas, design, technology, etc and not traditional
example: This street has a lot of cool, modern buildings.

meaning: Narrow things measure a small distance from one side to the other.
example: The streets in the old part of town are very narrow.

meaning: Noisy people or things make a lot of noise.
example: The theatre is crowded and noisy.

meaning: not special, different, or unusual in any way
example: We’ve stopped for lunch at an ordinary LA diner.

meaning: happening, used, or in a place that is outside and not inside a building

meaning: quiet and calm
example: I love this time of the day as it’s so peaceful and quiet down on Venice Beach.

meaning: If a place or an object is pretty, it is pleasant to look at.
example: Everyone goes to look at the pretty flowers.

meaning: without much noise or activity
example: I love this time of the day as it’s so peaceful and quiet down on Venice Beach.

meaning: extremely small
example: He lives in a tiny house.

meaning: unpleasant to look at
example: The new building opposite the university is ugly.

meaning: measuring a long distance or longer than usual from one side to the other
example: This road isn't wide enough for a bus.

meaning: a long, thin piece of leather, cloth, or plastic that you wear around your waist
example: He wore brown trousers with a red belt.

meaning: a shoe that covers your foot and part of your leg
example: I bought my boots from the new shoe shop opposite the café.

meaning: shoes with very low heels
example: Bring flat shoes for walking around town.

meaning: to buy a new set of clothes
example: I’m going to go shopping and get a new outfit.

meaning: a piece of clothing which covers your fingers and hand
example: It was a really cold day, so she decided to put on her scarf and gloves.

meaning: to go to a place where you can have your skin, hair, nails, etc. treated to make you look better

meaning: to go to a place where you can have your hair washed, cut, coloured etc
example: I need a haircut so I’m going to the hairdresser's this afternoon.

meaning: a bag carried by a woman with her money, keys, etc inside

meaning: to cut the hair off your face and chin

meaning: a warm piece of clothing which covers the top of your body and is pulled on over your head

meaning: to look as attractive as possible

meaning: a piece of jewellery that you wear around your neck

meaning: a coat that you wear when it is raining

meaning: a very short pair of trousers that stop above the knee
example: She is wearing shorts and sandals.

meaning: something that you wear on your foot inside your shoe

meaning: a jacket and trousers or a jacket and skirt that are made from the same material
example: Giles is going to buy himself a new suit.

meaning: soft sports shoes
example: She wears trainers for running.

meaning: the clothes that you wear next to your skin, under your other clothes

meaning: to wear attractive clothes

meaning: a piece of jewellery that you wear around your wrist
example: Shall I wear the gold bracelet and necklace or the black one?

meaning: a piece of jewellery that you wear on your ear
example: How about these earrings? They’re really beautiful.

meaning: shoes with high parts under the back part of your foot
example: I’ve found a gorgeous red dress and matching high heels.

meaning: light shoes with straps that you wear in warm weather

meaning: a piece of cloth that you wear around your neck, head, or shoulders to keep warm or for decoration
example: It was a really cold day, so she decided to put on her scarf and gloves.

meaning: a piece of clothing made of soft cotton which covers the top of your body and is pulled on over your head
example: He wore jeans and a sweatshirt.

meaning: a long, thin piece of cloth that a man wears around his neck with a shirt
example: He always wears a tie when he goes for a job interview.

meaning: a piece of women's clothing made of very thin material that covers the legs and bottom
example: I wore a skirt and black tights.

meaning: a piece of women's clothing worn on the upper part of the body
example: I need a top to wear with this skirt.

meaning: loose, comfortable clothes, usually trousers and a top, especially worn for exercising
example: I’m going to put my tracksuit on and go for a run.

meaning: someone who draws and plans how something will be made
example: I work for a number of companies as a book designer.

meaning: someone, especially a man, whose job is to perform in plays and films
example: We will still need actors and musicians to entertain us.

meaning: an employee of a bank who deals with customers, receives and pays out money, etc.
example: My friend works as a bank clerk in the city.

meaning: someone who makes or repairs buildings as a job
example: Someone suggested I train to be a builder.

meaning: someone who looks after a person who is young, old, or ill
example: We’ll need carers to look after us in old age.

meaning: someone whose job is to write instructions for computers
example: My sister is a computer programmer.

meaning: a person whose job is to  design, build, repair or control machines, engines, or electrical equipment
example: She has a job as a software engineer.

meaning: someone whose job is to understand the law and deal with legal situations
example: We need lawyers to argue for us.

meaning: someone who plays a musical instrument, often as a job
example: We will still need actors and musicians to entertain us.

meaning: someone who works in politics, especially a member of the government
example: We need politicians to make the big decisions for us.

meaning: a man who takes and brings letters and parcels as a job
example: Some postmen might lose their jobs, because people will send everything by email in the future.

meaning: someone whose job is selling things in a shop
example: There won't be many jobs for shop assistants because more people will shop online.

meaning: someone who has a lot of experience, knowledge, or skill in a particular subject
example: I think this issue needs a specialist.

meaning: a person who drives a taxi as a job
example: The taxi driver who took us to the airport was very sociable.

meaning: used to tell someone not to worry
example: Don't worry if you're too busy to come.

meaning: used to say that something isn't important, or won't affect what happens
example: It doesn't matter if we're late because we haven't booked for a certain time.

meaning: used to tell someone not to worry about something because it is not important
example: Oh, never mind about missing dinner, it wasn't that important.

meaning: said to show that you will or can do what someone has asked you to
example: I can do that for you, no problem.

meaning: a woman whose job is to perform in plays and films
example: She's a TV actress.

meaning: someone who designs buildings
example: I decided to study to become an architect.

meaning: someone who has an important job in a bank
example: Bankers often earn a lot of money.

meaning: to work for yourself not for a company
example: I’m self-employed, which means I work on my own and not in a team.

meaning: to meet and talk to people every day as part of your job
example: I'm a shop assistant, so I deal with people every day.

meaning: to take action to solve important problems
example: The engineers sometimes have to deal with serious problems.

meaning: to get a lot of money from your job
example: When I’m busy I can earn a very good salary.

meaning: someone whose job is to put in, check, or repair electrical wires and equipment
example: We need an electrician to fix the lights.

meaning: someone who works in a garden, growing plants and making it look attractive
example: My grandparents have a gardener now.

meaning: to be good at doing a lot of things
example: Doctors need to have a lot of skills.

meaning: to work in a place that is pleasant
example: I can work at home, so I can say that I have a really nice working environment!

meaning: to decide about things that are important
example: Managers have to make important decisions for the company.

meaning: If you need good qualifications to do a job, you must pass a lot of exams.
example: You need good qualifications to be a lawyer.

meaning: If a job needs several years of training, you have to learn it for several years before you can do it well.
example: You need several years of training to be a vet.

meaning: someone whose job is to repair or connect water pipes and things like toilets and baths
example: The plumber came to fix the sink.

meaning: a female postman
example: The postwoman comes early in the morning.

meaning: someone who studies science or works in science
example: Tim Berners-Lee was the scientist who invented the World Wide Web.

meaning: to work together with a group of people
example: I’ve always liked working in a team.

meaning: to work for a long time every day
example: When I’m very busy I have to work long hours.

meaning: to work on Saturday and Sunday
example: I sometimes have to work weekends.

meaning: someone whose job is to keep or examine the financial records of a company or organization
example: My father's an accountant.

meaning: someone whose job is to wash, cut, colour, etc people's hair
example: I'm a hairdresser and I work in a very fashionable salon.

meaning: someone who works with computers and other electronic equipment
example: Are you an IT worker?

meaning: someone whose job is to write articles for newspapers and magazines
example: Martin Lewis is a British journalist, TV presenter and writer.

meaning: someone whose job is to give medical care to animals that are ill or hurt
example: When I was little, I wanted to be a vet because I loved looking after animals.

meaning: to get to a place
example: We arrived at the check-in desk after the plane had left.

meaning: to say something to someone as a question
example: Who can you ask about problems at school or work?

meaning: to say to someone that you want them to give you something or do something for you
example: You should ask for a few days off.

meaning: to use something that belongs to someone else and give it back later
example: Don’t borrow money from friends because it causes problems.

meaning: to think very carefully about something you are doing and nothing else
example: What stops you concentrating on your work?

meaning: to take action in order to achieve something or solve a problem
example: What is a problem you have to deal with every day?

meaning: to give attention to something in order to hear them
example: Do you listen to music while you clean?

meaning: to turn your eyes in the direction of something so that you can see it
example: How often do you look at your phone?

meaning: to give money to someone in order to buy something from them
example: He paid for his friend's meal.

meaning: to use money to buy or pay for something
example: Only spend money on things you really need.

meaning: to say things to someone
example: Talk to a doctor about how you feel.

meaning: to use your mind to imagine a situation
example: Do you think about your work at weekends?

meaning: to use your mind to produce an idea or a solution
example: You should think of ways to save energy.

meaning: to not do something until something else happens
example: You should wait for the sales to buy expensive things.

meaning: feeling happy and comfortable because nothing is worrying you
example: Customers should feel relaxed and get excellent service.

meaning: making you feel relaxed
example: We spend a lot of our time in the swimming pool - it's so relaxing!

meaning: extremely surprised
example: Everyone was amazed by the fireworks.

meaning: very good
example: The fireworks looked amazing.

meaning: slightly angry
example: Magda was annoyed by the music from the neighbour’s flat.

meaning: making you feel annoyed
example: The music from the neighbour’s flat was really annoying.

meaning: unable to think clearly or to understand something
example: Andreas was very confused by the road signs.

meaning: difficult to understand
example: The road signs were really confusing.

meaning: unhappy because someone or something was not as good as you hoped or expected, or because something did not happen
example: Will was very disappointed by his present.

meaning: making you feel disappointed
example: Will’s birthday present was very disappointing.

meaning: feeling ashamed or shy
example: Liza was embarrassed by her boyfriend’s dancing.

meaning: making you feel embarrassed
example: Liza’s boyfriend’s dancing was embarrassing.

meaning: feeling very happy and enthusiastic
example: It’s my first time at a premiere so I’m so excited.

meaning: making you feel very happy and enthusiastic
example: The football match was very exciting.

meaning: afraid or nervous
example: Mehmet was frightened of the animals.

meaning: making you feel afraid or nervous
example: Mehmet thought the animals were frightening.

meaning: wanting to give your attention to something and discover more about it
example: Tracy isn’t very interested in computer games.

meaning: Someone or something that is interesting keeps your attention because they are unusual, exciting, or have lots of ideas.
example: It was interesting to learn about sharks.

meaning: very surprised and upset
example: They were shocked when they got the bill for the meal.

meaning: very surprising and upsetting
example: Their behaviour was very shocking.

meaning: feeling surprise because something has happened that you did not expect
example: Anita was surprised to get the news from her sister.

meaning: not expected and making someone feel surprised
example: Anita got some surprising news from her sister.

meaning: feeling that you want to rest or sleep
example: Sara was tired after a long day at work.

meaning: making you feel tired
example: Sara had a really tiring day at work.
